text: Who is the author of the first Epistle of Peter?
verseText: Peter, an apostle of Jesus Christ, To those who are elect exiles of the Dispersion in Pontus, Galatia, Cappadocia, Asia, and Bithynia,

text: A major theme in 1 Peter is how believers should respond to what?
verseText: In this you rejoice, though now for a little while, if necessary, you have been grieved by various trials... For this is a gracious thing, when, mindful of God, one endures sorrows while suffering unjustly... But even if you should suffer for righteousness' sake, you will be blessed... Beloved, do not be surprised at the fiery trial when it comes upon you to test you...

text: 1 Peter 1 describes the believer's inheritance as what?
options: Imperishable, undefiled, and unfading, kept in heaven
verseText: to an inheritance that is imperishable, undefiled, and unfading, kept in heaven for you,

text: What command does Peter give in 1 Peter 1:15-16, quoting Leviticus?
verseText: but as he who called you is holy, you also be holy in all your conduct, since it is written, “You shall be holy, for I am holy.”

text: In 1 Peter 2, believers are described using what titles?
options: A chosen race, a royal priesthood, a holy nation, a people for his own possession
verseText: But you are a chosen race, a royal priesthood, a holy nation, a people for his own possession, that you may proclaim the excellencies of him who called you out of darkness into his marvelous light.

text: How does Peter instruct believers to relate to governing authorities (1 Peter 2)?
options: Be subject for the Lord's sake to every human institution
verseText: Be subject for the Lord's sake to every human institution, whether it be to the emperor as supreme, or to governors as sent by him to punish those who do evil and to praise those who do good.

text: 1 Peter 3 provides instructions for wives and husbands. What example is given for wives regarding submission and conduct?
options: Holy women of the past, like Sarah
verseText: Likewise, wives, be subject to your own husbands... For this is how the holy women who hoped in God used to adorn themselves, by submitting to their own husbands, as Sarah obeyed Abraham, calling him lord.

text: What should be the believer's response when asked about the hope that is in them (1 Peter 3)?
options: Always be prepared to make a defense with gentleness and respect
verseText: but in your hearts honor Christ the Lord as holy, always being prepared to make a defense to anyone who asks you for a reason for the hope that is in you; yet do it with gentleness and respect,

text: According to 1 Peter 4, since Christ suffered in the flesh, believers should arm themselves with what same way of thinking?
verseText: Since therefore Christ suffered in the flesh, arm yourselves with the same way of thinking, for whoever has suffered in the flesh has ceased from sin,

text: Who does Peter warn believers about in 1 Peter 5, describing him as a 'roaring lion'?
verseText: Be sober-minded; be watchful. Your adversary the devil prowls around like a roaring lion, seeking someone to devour.
